special_features: Commentary by Sylvester McCoy, Sophie Aldred, and Nicholas Parsons
Nebula '90 - The cast and crew reunion
Modelling the Dead - Haemovore mask making
Claws and Effects - Visual effects tests
Shattering the Chains - Interview with Ian Briggs

notes: Originally titled The Wolves of Fenric.
First televised story set during World War II.
The ancient evil Fenric ties back to Norse mythology.

in_universe_mythology: Fenric, an ancient evil from the dawn of time
real_world_cultural_references: Norse mythology references such as Yggdrasil and Ragnarok

continuity_notes: References previous events in Dragonfire and Silver Nemesis.

plot.plot_summary: Part One: The Doctor and Ace arrive at a WWII naval base where sinister forces are at play involving ancient runes and a machine designed to decode German messages. They encounter espionage and supernatural threats.

Part Two: The situation escalates as the Doctor learns the dark purpose of the ULTIMA machine. Haemovores attack, revealing the dangers of the ancient curse tied to the Viking ancestors of the characters.
Part Three: The Doctor discovers that the Haemovores are the result of mankind's future evolution. He races against time to thwart Millington's plans and save his allies from the vengeful Fenric.
Part Four: The Doctor confronts Fenric in a high-stakes chess game that determines the fate of all involved. Themes of faith, betrayal, and destiny intertwine as Ace confronts her own past.
